title: ==> Error: invalid literal for int() with base 10: '' When installing

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I want to install the latest dealii. I have updated my spack with `git pull`.
On the developer branch, `spack spec` and `spack install` with any package name (tried dealii, gcc and libelf)
give the error 
 ```console 
==> Error: invalid literal for int() with base 10: ''
```
Reverting to the old spack commit where I was at before git pull (a940ff34d; this does not contain the latest dealii release), I can do `spack spec dealii@9.1.0` without getting the above error.

Should I maybe update other components of my system before the spack dealii install?

I did run `$ spack clean -a` in between failed installs. 

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ git pull
$ spack spec gcc
```

### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
```console
$ spack --debug --stacktrace install gcc
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2020-07-31-17:16:51.544707] Imported install from built-in commands
lib/spack/spack/config.py:805 ==> [2020-07-31-17:16:51.546102] Reading config file /Applications/Spack/spack/etc/spack/defaults/config.yaml
lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py:122 ==> [2020-07-31-17:16:51.560562] Imported install from built-in commands
lib/spack/spack/config.py:805 ==> [2020-07-31-17:16:51.562857] Reading config file /Applications/Spack/spack/etc/spack/defaults/repos.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:805 ==> [2020-07-31-17:16:51.656260] Reading config file /Applications/Spack/spack/etc/spack/defaults/packages.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:805 ==> [2020-07-31-17:16:51.671428] Reading config file /Applications/Spack/spack/etc/spack/defaults/darwin/packages.yaml
lib/spack/spack/config.py:805 ==> [2020-07-31-17:16:51.732760] Reading config file /Users/acglerum/.spack/darwin/compilers.yaml
lib/spack/spack/util/executable.py:159 ==> [2020-07-31-17:16:51.775700] '/usr/bin/clang' '--version'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/bin/spack", line 64, in <module>
    sys.exit(spack.main.main())
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 762, in main
    return _invoke_command(command, parser, args, unknown)
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 490, in _invoke_command
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 330, in install
    args.spec, concretize=True, tests=tests)
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py", line 164, in parse_specs
    spec.concretize(tests=tests)  # implies normalize
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 2171, in concretize
    self._concretize_helper(concretizer))
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 1996, in _concretize_helper
    concretizer, presets, visited
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 1996, in _concretize_helper
    concretizer, presets, visited
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 1996, in _concretize_helper
    concretizer, presets, visited
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 2009, in _concretize_helper
    concretizer.adjust_target(self),
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/concretize.py", line 525, in adjust_target
    return next(self._adjust_target_answer_generator)
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/concretize.py", line 518, in _make_only_one_call
    yield self._adjust_target(spec)
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/concretize.py", line 560, in _adjust_target
    current_target.optimization_flags(spec.compiler)
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/architecture.py", line 226, in optimization_flags
    compiler.name, str(compiler_version)
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/cpu/microarchitecture.py", line 256, in optimization_flags
    if satisfies_constraint(compiler_entry, version):
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/cpu/microarchitecture.py", line 242, in satisfies_constraint
    version = tuplify(version)
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/cpu/microarchitecture.py", line 240, in <lambda>
    tuplify = lambda x: tuple(int(y) for y in x.split('.'))
  File "/Applications/Spack/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/cpu/microarchitecture.py", line 240, in <genexpr>
    tuplify = lambda x: tuple(int(y) for y in x.split('.'))
ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: '
```

``` console
* **Python:** 3.7.4
* **Platform:** darwin-mojave-skylake
```

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output


<!-- We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively!

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack! -->
